lines.text: The students are supposed to keep their minds on their studies and you girls must remember, that we're only here to satisfy their appetite... for food.
Is this girl a friend of yours?
Maybe she could tell me how to do it.
Well, we got very friendly and I slept in his Drawing Room.
Yeh, Tom had to double up to get in my berth but he said he didn't mind.

You know this instant reminds me of one of old Aesop's fables - the one about the wolf in sheep's clothing, of course. Only in this instance, the wolf turns out to be an exchange professor from England. Of course, I realize how disappointed you must be that I haven't a long white beard and that however much of an old fluff I may be, it isn't apparent to the naked eye. I hope. All you have to do is to pass a rather stiff examination at the end of the term. And before I hear too many groans, let me say that I'm going to begin the course by exploring the nightlife of Cytherea - a rather high-spirited wench of ancient times. As a matter of fact, so high spirited that students have been known to take up Greek just in order to read it in the original. Well, hip-hip, dash it all, shall we carry on?
